title: Design Considerations for Applications of Social Robots in the Stuttering Clinic
authors: Priyank Avijeet, Shruti Chandra, Smita Misra, Kerstin Dautenhahn
venue: International Conference on Social Robotics (ICSR + AI 2024)
description: This study explores the integration of social robots into stuttering therapy sessions for preschoolers. Through interviews and observations with Speech-Language Pathologists (SLPs), the research identifies practical applications and design considerations for human-robot interactions in clinical settings. Key findings suggest that social robots can engage children through interactive games and provide consistent speech models, with interactions being structured and supervised by SLPs.

title: Greeting Preferences in a Hospitality Context: A Cross-Cultural Study with a Social Robot
authors: Priyank Avijeet, Pourya Aliasghari, Kerstin Dautenhahn
venue: 33rd IEEE International Conference on Robot and Human Interactive Communication (RO-MAN)
description: A cross-cultural study examining greeting preferences in hospitality contexts using social robots. This research explores how cultural differences influence human-robot interaction preferences, particularly in service-oriented environments.
